mainEntity.name: How do you upsell on Shopify?

acceptedAnswer.text: First, install an upsell app from the Shopify App Store. Then create specific offers that suggest product upgrades and display them on product pages, in cart, or at checkout. You can also present post-purchase upsells on the thank you page.
Upselling is a sales strategy to get customers to buy a more expensive version of something they're already looking at, with upgrades or add-ons that make it feel more premium.

mainEntity.name: What's the difference between upselling and cross-selling?

acceptedAnswer.text: Upselling offers a better, more expensive version of the same product (vertical upgrade), while cross-selling recommends related or complementary items (horizontal additions).

mainEntity.name: When should you use pre-purchase vs post-purchase upsells?

acceptedAnswer.text: Pre-purchase upsells work best on product pages while customers are comparing options. Post-purchase upsells are safer as they don't risk losing the original sale and have higher conversion rates.

@graph.description: Offering a slightly cheaper, less fancy alternative when a customer looks like they're about to walk away due to price

@graph.name: Average Order Value (AOV)
@graph.description: The average amount of money spent each time a customer places an order
